common_issues.title: Pieces OS LTM and Workstream Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with the Pieces OS Long Term Memory (LTM) and Workstream features, primarily on macOS. Issues include LTM queries failing after extended use, Workstream activity not updating, and the "Clear LTM Data" button being unresponsive.  One user reported success after removing all Pieces data, suggesting potential performance issues with large datasets. Additionally, there are reports of the Pieces Copilot Service failing to open.

related_issues.title: Bug: Subscription is not showing up within the Application(cancelation + resubscription w/ a new plan)
related_issues.text:
Bug: Subscription is not showing up within the Application(cancelation + resubscription w/ a new plan)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

So when I freshly install Pieces, the LTM works fine.

When I've had it running for a few weeks, and I want to query the LTM, the query takes forever, and returns nothing.

The same happens via the MCP.

I use my machine all day, so there's a lot of context going into the LTM. The only explanation I can come up with is that it's just getting too big. The Workstream is, however, updating fine.

Removing all my Pieces data gets the LTM working again, but then I end up with this situation later. This is the third time I've been through this loop. It's really frustrating, because when I actually need the LTM, it fails.

The Clear LTM Data button doesn't work, just returning to Try again, from All Data to even for just clearing an hour of data.

I haven't cleared the LTM (well, I've tried, but the Clear LTM Data button doesn't work) so we have a live broken environment to debug with. I'm more than happy to assist with debugging this - let me know what you need!

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and plugins encounter various bugs
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS and its plugins across different operating systems (primarily Windows). These include: 1. Inability to drag files into conversation context. 2. File choosing window appearing behind other windows. 3. Filter rules not applying to all file types. 4. Pieces support opening by default on launch. 5. LLM not upgrading to the latest version despite user selection and configuration changes.  Further investigation is needed to identify the root causes and solutions.

related_issues.title: Pro user's LLM cannot be upgraded to the latest version, even if they are chosen to
related_issues.text: Pro user's LLM cannot be upgraded to the latest version, even if they are chosen to ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Pieces OS, Visual Studio, Sublime Plugin, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform Windows 11 ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I have a small problem now that cannot be solved through LLM: - I have inquired with LLM in **pieces for developers** and **pieces vscode plugin**, and they all said they are Sonnet 3.5. - The pieces LLM in sublime (set claude 3.7 sonnet) keeps silence about this: **Copilot**: I'm an AI assistant created by Anthropic named Claude, and my training data has a cutoff date. While I don't typically specify my exact version details, I can tell you that my knowledge cutoff is around late 2023. This means I don't have information about events, technologies, or developments that occurred after that time. However, - I just **upgraded to Pieces Pro yesterday** and have switched to Sonnet 4 (for all pieces IDE plugins and Desktop Apps, except for sublime which only support sonnet 3.7 till now). - Every test chat was opened in a new Chat after the LLM is switched( to Sonnet 4 or Gemini 2.5 Pro)... - I've checked the configuration files and they are all Sonnet 4 without any issues. - I have tried restarting my computer or logging in to my account again, but still have this bug - I have tried changing my computer and VPN node, including canceling or adding the global system proxy, but none of them worked PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. ## Pieces for Deveopers (desktop app) ## Vscode plugin ## Sublime plugin Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 12.1.1 Bugs and Feature Requests
common_issues.description: Users report issues with copying code blocks, dragging files into conversation context, and LLM not upgrading to the latest version (Sonnet 4) despite Pro subscription.  Copying inline code blocks and inter-line code blocks produces unexpected behavior.  Dragging files into conversation context fails.  LLM remains at Sonnet 3.5 in Pieces for Developers and VS Code plugin, and silent in Sublime, despite selecting Sonnet 4 in settings.  Users request partial copying for inline code blocks.

related_issues.title: Copy python code block = copy message ? what a big mistake !!
related_issues.text: Copy python code block = copy message ? what a big mistake !! ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. 1. The 2nd pic below do not function properly: The description of this problem only requires one line equation, and inequality of graphics: - it should be: Copy copilot message ≠ Copy `inter-line code block` (floating) = Copy `inter-line code block` (fixed) - however: = ≠ - how could Copy `inter-line code block` (floating)= Copy `inter-line code block` (floating) ? absolute wrong. - it should be like: Copy `inter-line code block` (floating)= Copy `inter-line code block` (fixed) by design. 2. Copy improperly: if one copies `in-line code block` through ctrl+c (rather than the "copy button" provided alongside), it is very likely (coupled with double click) to paste it into " ￼ ". 3. Feature: Hopefully, the `in-line code block` can be partially copied (rather than merely allowing all copies) like the inter-line code block to improve efficiency. common_issues.title: Pieces Pro Upgrade and Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty upgrading to Pieces Pro, with the checkout process failing to complete.  Additionally, some users report connectivity problems between Pieces OS and browser extensions, even with VPNs configured.  Further investigation is needed to determine the root cause and potential solutions.

related_issues.title: Pieces Pro: checkout is not opening
related_issues.text: Pieces Pro: checkout is not opening ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Hi guys! I want to try a "Pro" plan, however the modal with payment is not opening and the button "Upgrade Now" turns to "Awaiting checkout..." and nothing happens. I've tried through the Desktop App, Pieces OS app - neither helped. Could you please advice? Default Browser: Arc (if it helps) PiecesOs Log Attached [log-08102025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21704376/log-08102025.txt) Pieces for Developers log string: ``` [D] Checking PiecesOS Connection and Compatibility [D] Checking PiecesOS Version Number via port: 39300 [D] Checking PiecesOS Connection and Compatibility [D] Checking PiecesOS Version Number via port: 39300 [D] App Interaction: app_header_searchbar_settings_button_popover_button [D] Checking PiecesOS Connection and Compatibility [D] Checking PiecesOS Version Number via port: 39300 [D] Dispatching Route [DIALOG OPEN]: true [D] Dispatching Route [SHEET OPEN]: false [D] Dispatching Route [CURRENT ROUTE]: PiecesProInformationDialog [D] Dispatching Route [ROUTE STACK]: [/workstream, PiecesProInformationDialog] [D] Dispatching Route [ENTRY]: / [D] Dispatching Route [HOME]: /workstream [D] App Interaction: app_header_searchbar_settings_button_popover_upgrade_to_pro_button [D] Dispatching Route [DIALOG OPEN]: false [D] Dispatching Route [SHEET OPEN]: false [D] Dispatching Route [CURRENT ROUTE]: /workstream [D] Dispatching Route [ROUTE STACK]: [/workstream] [D] Dispatching Route [ENTRY]: / [D] Dispatching Route [HOME]: /workstream [D] Checking PiecesOS Connection and Compatibility [D] Checking PiecesOS Version Number via port: 39300 ``` Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. related_issues.title: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS
related_issues.text: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Web Extension, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Even if the VPN for the browser plugin is turned off, and the virtual network card and global proxy for the desktop VPN are turned on, it is still not possible to connect the browser, including the edge and Chrome pieces plugins, to the pieces OS. PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. - Pieces OS has been upgraded to Pro. common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users report connection leaks and failures with Pieces Desktop and browser extensions.  The desktop app creates excessive connections to Pieces OS, impacting performance. Browser extensions, even with VPN configurations, struggle to connect.  Temporary solutions include closing the desktop app or restarting Pieces OS.  Issues appear across Windows and involve Pieces OS versions 12.1.1 and 12.2.0, and Pieces for Developers 4.3.1.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Connection Leak
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop Connection Leak
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS, Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 4.3.1 and Pieces OS 12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have pieces MCP server installed in my Windows vscode. Snippet below. I had issues with it stopping suddenly. With help of vscode github copilot we determined that it was connections were used up. Investigation yielded that when Pieces Desktop not running only two connections present. When I started Pieces Desktop connections jumped to 50.  Below the MCP config snippet is copy of github copilot working session.

"pieces": {
	"url": "http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse",
	"type": "http",
	"gallery": true,
	"autoStart": false,
	"timeout": 30000,
	"retryDelay": 5000,
	"maxRetries": 3
}

I have started pieces desktop app. I informed it of our changes which it concurs. Can you check connection status and health of pieces now that I have stared pieces desktop?

I'll check the connection status and health of the Pieces MCP server now that you've started the Pieces desktop app.

⚠️ The connection leak problem is back! Let me check which processes are involved:

Problem Identified! 🚨
The issue is that starting the Pieces Desktop app (pieces_for_x.exe) has re-created the connection leak problem:

Process 35956: os_server.exe (Pieces OS) - listening on port 39300
Process 29660: Code.exe (VS Code) - 1 connection (good)
Process 37316: pieces_for_x.exe (Pieces Desktop) - 50+ connections (bad!)

The Root Cause:
The Pieces Desktop application itself has a connection leak bug - it's creating excessive connections to the Pieces OS server, just like we saw before with VS Code.

Solutions:
Option 1: Temporary Fix (Close Pieces Desktop)
Option 2: Keep Pieces Desktop but Monitor
If you need the Pieces Desktop app running, you can:

Monitor connections periodically
Restart Pieces OS periodically to clear leaks
Report this as a bug to Pieces support
Let's check if closing the desktop app fixed the connections:

Perfect! Now let's test the MCP connection:

pieces (MCP Server)
Connection Status: ✅ HEALTHY!
Perfect! The Pieces MCP server is now working correctly with excellent connection health:

Current Status:
✅ 2 established connections (down from 50+)
✅ MCP server responding successfully
✅ Clean connection state with minimal overhead
✅ No connection leaks
Root Cause Confirmed:
The issue was specifically with the Pieces Desktop application (pieces_for_x.exe) creating excessive connections. The Pieces OS (os_server.exe) and VS Code MCP integration work fine together.

Current Working Configuration:
Pieces OS: Running and healthy
VS Code MCP: Connected with proper timeout settings
Pieces Desktop: Stopped (to prevent connection leaks)
Today's Work Context Retrieved:
From the MCP response, I can see you're actively working on:

Database Mapping Projects:

GWM-22316: Map database tables to GWMS UI elements
GWM-22318: Customer SVP database migration
Customer and facility screen analysis
Development Tools:

VS Code with MCP integration
Oracle SQL Developer for database work
Time tracking with Toggl and Clockk
Recent Focus Areas:

Vite platform work
Keycloak maintenance
Research flow documentation with LLMs
Recommendation:
Keep the current setup as-is:

✅ Use Pieces OS for the MCP integration (working perfectly)
⚠️ Avoid Pieces Desktop until they fix the connection leak bug
✅ Monitor connections occasionally with netstat if needed
The MCP integration is now stable and providing excellent work context tracking without the connection leak issues!

recommendations: Prioritize resolving issues related to LTM and Workstream functionality on macOS (especially ticket #805 and #799).
Investigate and address the Pieces OS and plugin bugs on Windows, focusing on file dragging, window behavior, and filter rules (ticket #822).
Address the LLM upgrade failure for Pro users across different plugins (ticket #818).
Fix the Pieces Pro checkout process to ensure smooth upgrades (ticket #825).
Resolve the connection leak issue between Pieces Desktop and Pieces OS, and the connection problems with browser extensions (ticket #816 and #819).
Improve code block copying functionality in the desktop app and consider partial copying for inline code blocks (ticket #821).
